channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: Pg_lake: Postgres with Iceberg and data lake access
item.description:
pg_lake: Postgres for Iceberg and Data lakes pg_lake integrates Iceberg and data lake files into Postgres. Using pg_lake Create an Iceberg table You can create Iceberg tables by adding USING iceberg to your CREATE TABLE statements. -- Copy data from Postgres to S3 with format parquet -- Read from any data source, including iceberg tables, heap tables or any query results COPY (SELE.

Read more

item.title: Launch HN: Plexe (YC X25) – Build production-grade ML models from prompts
item.description:
Tailored ML solutions for your industry, deployed instantly. Tailored ML solutions for your industry, deployed instantly. Protect your customers and your bottom line with AI that spots suspicious activity before it becomes a problem.

Read more

item.title: Exploring a space-based, scalable AI infrastructure system design
item.description:
This orbital choice maximizes solar energy collection and reduces the need for heavy onboard batteries. Delivering performance comparable to terrestrial data centers requires links between satellites that support tens of terabits per second. Our analysis indicates that this should be possible with multi-channel dense wavelength-division multiplexing (DWDM) transceivers and spatial multiplexing.

Read more

item.title: We're open-sourcing the successor of Jupyter notebook
item.description:
”However, it fails modern data teams, data agents, and… data itself. Teams need notebooks that are reactive, collaborative, and AI‑ready. Today, we’re announcing that Deepnote is going open source.

item.title: This Day in 1988, the Morris worm infected 10% of the Internet within 24 hours
item.description:
Morris worm dissectionKnown to be something of a prankster, Morris must have felt some foreboding about releasing his ‘innocent’ program into the wild. Thankfully, the Morris worm wasn’t written to cause damage to files. Morris worm isolated safely on a floppy.

Read more

item.title: Michael Burry a.k.a. "Big Short",discloses $1.1B bet against Nvidia&Palantir
item.description:
The 13-F filing released Monday discloses that Burry’s fund, Scion Asset Management, bought put options on roughly 5 million Palantir shares worth $912 million, and 1 million Nvidia shares worth $187 million. ” Scion also disclosed call options on Pfizer and Halliburton, alongside holdings in Lululemon, Bruker, Molina Healthcare, and Sallie Mae. 'Big Short' Michael Burry bet against Palantir and NvidiaThe 13-F filing released Monday discloses that Burry’s fund, Scion Asset Management, bought put options on roughly 5 million Palantir shares worth $912 million, and 1 million Nvidia shares worth $187 million.

Read more

item.title: The Rust Foundation Maintainers Fund
item.description:
The Rust Foundation Maintainers Fund is our commitment to act on that urgency transparently with ongoing Rust Project collaboration. To deliver on that mission, the Rust Foundation Maintainers Fund will invest directly in the people and projects that keep Rust strong. The Rust Foundation Maintainers Fund will operate within the governance framework shared between the Rust Project and the Rust Foundation, ensuring alignment and oversight at every level.

Read more

item.title: The 512KB Club
item.description:
Why does any site need to be that huge. Do you really need that extra piece of JavaScript. Your total UNCOMPRESSED web resources must not exceed 512KB.

item.title: US nuclear weapons testing can forever scar a nation.Just ask Marshall Island
item.description:
Does he understand how nuclear weapons work. How will US nuclear adversaries react. Tragic nuclear legacy In the Marshall Islands, the wounds of nuclear testing are still raw.

item.title: Data breach at major Swedish software supplier impacts 1.5M
item.description:
Data breach at major Swedish software supplier impacts 1. The data breach alerting service reports that the leaked data corresponds to 870,000 people, which is roughly half the figure provided by IMY. 2 million patients impacted in January data breachElectronics giant Avnet confirms breach, says stolen data unreadable.

item.title: Server DRAM prices surge 50% as AI-induced memory shortage hits hyperscalers
item.description:
This is causing retail DDR5 prices to creep upward, with no sign of stabilization before year’s end. Unless demand unexpectedly cools or yields improve sharply, DRAM allocation for everyone outside the top buyers will be constrained into 2026. 2 Comments Comment from the forums It's also causing desktop and laptop DRAM prices to inflate massively.

Read more
